document.docTitle: Pterygosoma dhofarensis Fajfer & Melnikov, 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New species and records of scale mites (Acari: Pterygosomatidae) from Arabian agamid lizards (Squamata: Agamidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and records of scale mites (Acari: Pterygosomatidae) from Arabian agamid lizards (Squamata: Agamidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. FEMALE ( holotype ,
Figs. 5–6
).
Gnathosoma
. Cheliceral base about 70 ( 65–70 in 8 paratypes ) long, cheliceral shaft 75 ( 65–70 ) long. Fixed cheliceral digit 15 long, with spinous process. Movable cheliceral digit with basal spur. Palpal femur with smooth spin-like setae, 15 long. Palp genu with smooth setae 20 long. Palpal tibia with 3 smooth setae and short claw. Palpal tarsi with 3 smooth setae. Subcapitulum without setae n . Free lateral part of peritremal branch about 20 long. Hypostome 115 long, with slightly flattened apex. Idiosoma 450 long ( 430–480 in 8 paratypes ) and 815 wide ( 770–845 ). Dorsum (
Fig. 5
A). Anterior part of idiosoma with 22–30 pairs of serrated setae, 15–20 long, arranged in 2 groups: mesal group consisting of 16–20 setae, lateral group consisting of 7–10 setae. Two pairs of slightly serrated setae, 10–25 long, and 3–4 pairs of latero-median serrated setae, 25–45 long present posterior to lateral group. Medial part of idiosoma with 3 pairs of dorso-median setae:
dm 1
serrated, 10 long;
dm 2
filiform, 40 long;
dm 3
serrated and slightly apically expanded, 60 long. Postero-lateral part of idiosoma with 2 pairs of apically expanded setae with minute spicules on apical part, 30–40 long. Eyes present. Venter (
Fig. 5
B) with 3 pairs of smooth ventro-median setae:
vm 1 –vm 3
(in holotype and 1 paratype additional unpaired seta
vm 4
observed). Genital slit situated mainly ventrally. Genital series represented by 4 pairs of spin-like setae
g 1 –g 4
; all genital setae subequal in length, 20–25 long. Pseudoanal setal series represented by 6 pairs of setae:
ps 1
smooth or very slightly serrated, 25 long,
ps 2–6
paddle-shaped, 45–70 long, with minute spicules on apical margin. Legs. Coxal setation:
1 a
,
1 b
,
2 b
,
3 a
,
3 b
arranged in formula 2 – 1–2 –0, all setae filiform; setae of trochanters I–IV ( 1 – 1 – 1 – 1 ), femora I–IV ( 3 – 1 – 1 – 1 ), genua I–IV ( 2 –0–0–0), tibiae I–IV ( 5 – 3 – 3 – 3 ). All setae on each segment filiform, except for slightly plumose setae: v”FI and dFII–III . Setation of tarsi:
I 13
setae ( ft , tc’ , tc” , p’ , p” , a’ , a” , it’ , it” , u’ , u” , vs’ , vs” ) and solenidion
ω 1
;
II 8
setae ( tc’ , p’ , p” , it’ , it” , u’ , u” , vs’ ) and
ω 1
; III and IV with 8 setae each ( tc’ , p’ , p” , it’ , it” , u’ , u” , vs’ ). Setae tc’ , tc” , a’ , a” of leg I represented by eupathidia, p’ and p” fan-like. Setae tc’ of legs II–IV and setae it’ , it” , u’ , u” , vs’ , vs” of legs I–IV smooth.

MALE ( 2 paratypes ,
Fig. 7
).
Gnathosoma
as in female. Cheliceral base and shaft 45 long. Fixed cheliceral digit short (about 5 long) with spinous process. Hypostome 55 long with smooth rounded apex. Free lateral part of peritremal branch about 5–10 long. Idiosoma 230–255 long, 465–510 wide. Dorsum (
Fig. 7
A) with 3 groupings of serrated setae: 16–17 pairs of antero-lateral setae, 10–20 long; 4 pairs of medio-lateral setae, 25–40 long and 3 pairs of dorso-median setae:
dm 1
25 long;
dm 2 –dm 3
about 35 long. Eyes present. Aedeagus about 110 long, directed forward; genital anal opening with 2 pairs of filiform setae. Venter (
Fig. 7
B) with 3 pairs of ventro-median setae:
vm 1
filiform,
vm 2 –vm 3
slightly serrated. Legs as in female.

DEUTONYMPH ( 1 paratype ,
Fig. 8
).
Gnathosoma
as in female. Cheliceral base and shaft 70 long. Fixed cheliceral digit 20 long, with spinous process. Movable cheliceral digit with basal spur. Palpal femur and genu with smooth setae each, about 20 long. Free lateral part of peritremal branch about 15 long. Hypostome 95 long, with slightly flattened apex. Idiosoma 355 long and 555 wide. Dorsum (
Fig. 8
A). Anterior part of idiosoma with 23 pairs of slightly serrated setae, about 20 long, arranged in 2 groups: mesial group of 16 setae, lateral group of 7 setae. Below the lateral group 2 pairs of fine-pointed slightly serrated setae, 20–30 long, present. Medial part of idiosoma with 4 pairs of dorso-median setae:
dm 1 –dm 3
slightly serrated, about 25, 35 and 40 long, respectively, setae
dm 4
slightly apically expanded, 50–55 long. Venter (
Fig. 8
B) with 3 pairs of ventro-median setae:
vm 1 –vm 2
filiform,
vm 3
slightly serrated. Postero-lateral part of idiosoma with 5 pairs of setae of 2 types : short serrated setae (about 35 long), long setae ( 50–70 long) tapered or apically expanded with minute spicules in apical part. Genital series represented by 4 pairs of spin-like setae
g 1 –g 4
. Pseudoanal series represented by 1 pair of spin-like setae
ps 1
and 4–6 pairs of paddle-shaped setae
ps 2 –ps 6
( 2 unpaired setae ps present). Legs as in female.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Pterygosoma dhofarensis
sp. nov. ,
female. A , dorsal view; B , ventral view.

FIGURE 6.
Pterygosoma dhofarensis
sp. nov. ,
female; details. A , tarsus I in lateral view; B , tarsus II in lateral view; C , tarsus III in dorso-lateral view; D , gnathosoma in dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Female holotype and
4 female
paratypes from
Pseudotrapelus dhofarensis Melnikov and Pierson
( CAS 227594 ), OMAN : Dhofar, Ayoon,
17 º 15 ’N
,
53 º 54 ’E
,
13 Jul 2003
, coll. T. J. Papenfuss;
4 female
, 1 deutonymph and
2 male
paratypes from same host ( ZISP 26979–26982 ), OMAN : Mirbat,
16 º 57 ’N
54 º 41 ’E
,
February 2013
, coll. R. A. Nazarov.

Type deposition.
Holotype ,
4 female
, 1 deutonymph and
1 male
paratypes in ZISP ,
3 female
and
1 male
paratypes in AMU (AMU–PTE11.1).

Etymology. The name
dhofarensis
refers to the species name of the host.

Differential diagnosis. This new species is similar to
P. sinaita
Jack, 1961
from
Pseudotrapelus sinaitus Heyden
and
Trapelus mutabilis Merrem
from and Arabian Peninsula and Egypt . In females of both these species the eyes are present, arrangement of the dorsal setae and setation of genua II–III and tarsi, tibiae, femora, trochanters I–IV are the same, setae dG are longer than dF , the antero-dorsal setae are slightly serrated, the genital slit is situalted mainly ventrally and the genital series is represented by four pairs of setae g and six pairs of the pseudoanal setae ps. This new species differs from
P. sinaita
by the following features: in female of
P . dhofarensis
setae
dm 1
are serrated and setae
dm 2
are filiform, three or four pairs of the medio-lateral setae and two pairs of the peripheral setae are present, setae dGI are absent. In females of
P. sinaita
, setae
dm 1
are filiform and setae
dm 2
are flattened, five or six pairs of the latero-median setae and three pairs of the peripheral setae are present, setae dGI are present.
